Content: wallet size doesn't change when you clean because cleared txes are padded, but all of the extra data is purged

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉 could you help me understand the workflow of UTXO's  and how NN operator goes about making best use of

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: dont know if workflow is best word..

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
the shortest answer is that you:
want enough that you will not run out when attempting to notarize
want few enough that it doesn't bog down when selecting one to use

It's a balance that can be micromanaged to death or left with a general "this works"

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: how exactly is the balance 'managed' effective technique?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: cleaning your wallet (or rebuilding as phm suggested) clears out extraneous (for our purposes) data that otherwise needs to be sorted through like any other database

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`how exactly is the balance 'managed' effective technique?`
automation is key, but should never be 100% left to think that it will "always" work properly
like anything else coded, the # of people you ask is how many answers you get as to what works "best"

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: mostly it's a "you have to watch and see what happens" thing to determine what you feel best with

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: what exactly are my ways of governing how my UTXOs get used ?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: also, for amount, that depends on how much your fastest chain moves in between the times you check and send your split transactions to the chain

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: the stats script from <https://github.com/KMDLabs/StakedNotary> run on a timer is an excellent starting place for observing

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: you shouldn't be able to run it "too often" and run out unless you put some really odd numbers in there

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: if you set up splitting properly you'll only split if a certain amount isn't on-hand, so it's not like you're creating an extra bajillion UTXOs every day that go unused
